Name: Linear Programming
Description: Determines the optimal solution to a linear objective function subject to constraints
Solvability: Generally solvable using simplex algorithm and dual simplex method
Example: Maximize profit for a manufacturer given resource constraints

Name: Nonlinear Programming
Description: Maximizes or minimizes a nonlinear objective function subject to nonlinear constraints
Appearances: Optimizing the cost function in machine learning using gradient descent

Name: Differential Calculus Optimization
Description: Involves finding the maximum or minimum of a function by applying calculus techniques like derivative test
Appearances: Solvable for most functions but depends on their complexity
column8: Finding the lowest point on a parabola

Name: Dynamic Programming
Description: Breaks down an optimization problem into smaller subproblems to find the optimal solution recursively
Solvability: Generally solvable if the Bellman equation holds
Example: Knapsack problem (0/1 knapsack and fractional knapsack)

Name: Integer Linear Programming
Description: Similar to linear programming but includes integer variables
Example: Maximizing profit for a trucking company with integer vehicle capacities

Name: Combinatorial Optimization
Description: Deals with finding the optimal solution from a finite set of items
Example: Graph coloring problem and Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP)

Name: Convex Optimization
Description: Focuses on optimization problems that involve convex functions
Example: Convex hull and linear programming duality

Name: Global Optimization
Description: Seeks the global optimum rather than a local one

Name: Evolutionary Algorithm
Description: Population-based search method that mimics biological evolution
Solvability: Generally used for complex problems with no known analytical solution
Example: Ant colony optimization (ACO) for the TSP

Name: Swarm Intelligence
Description: Simulates the behavior of swarms like birds and bees to solve complex optimization problems
Solvability: Generally used for large-scale problems where other methods fail
Example: Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) for function minimization
